intro: Psychotria prancei, commonly known as the Prance's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Central and South America, particularly in regions of Mexico, Guatemala, and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It often grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the canopy layer of the forest. Psychotria prancei is notable for its potential medicinal properties and is of interest to botanists and pharmacologists alike.
